body_html:
I faced a similar problem where segmentation fault was there with num_workers=4. All I did was run with num_workers=1 once and found that one of files in data was corrupted. I corrected that and again ran the model with num_workers=4 and it worked! If one of thread is facing problem, it is not printing error and code exits with segmentation fault.

Now, I'll check the model with num_workers=1 before trying with more workers. :)
body_text:
I faced a similar problem where segmentation fault was there with num_workers=4. All I did was run with num_workers=1 once and found that one of files in data was corrupted. I corrected that and again ran the model with num_workers=4 and it worked! If one of thread is facing problem, it is not printing error and code exits with segmentation fault.
Now, I'll check the model with num_workers=1 before trying with more workers. :)
body:
I faced a similar problem where segmentation fault was there with `num_workers=4`. All I did was run with `num_workers=1` once and found that one of files in data was corrupted. I corrected that and again ran the model with `num_workers=4` and it worked! If one of thread is facing problem, it is not printing error and code exits with segmentation fault.

Now, I'll check the model with `num_workers=1` before trying with more workers. :)
